ovdesc.p: This file is used when PRINTED account statements are to be produced outside of the DELIVERY SYSTEM. This is the case when the PRINT.BYPASS field on the delivery parameter record contains the message type 950.

Any statement with a carrier type of 'PRINT' will now generate an AC.STMT.HANDOFF record. This contains details of addresses, languages and copies, and any account information that may be required on a statement.
The generation of the Ac.Stmt.Handoff record will be suppressed if a message status of DELETE is specified on the DE.PRODUCT table relevant to the account.

A special statement printing routine specific to a particular customer's requirements is required to print the statements this routine processes the handoff records in a specified order. Once a statement has been printed, the handoff record is written to history if no errors were encountered, otherwise the errors are recorded on the handoff record and are reported at the end of the run.

Any statements with carriers other than 'PRINT' will still be processed by the delivery system. If a statement has both 'PRINT' and a different carrier, it will be processed by both the delivery system and the print routine. In this case delivery will ignore any 'PRINT' versions, and the print routine will only produce 'PRINT' versions.

Contains the amount of the limit record available on the date of statement production, for use when the account is linked to a limit.

The available amount is calculated as the ONLINE.LIMIT less the TOTAL.OS and the value of the account balances linked to the limit. The value is taken from the lowest level limit in the structure where an amount has been defined, and is converted to the account currency where the limit currency differs.

If the customer has a Credit Limit covering this account, this field identifies the type of Limit applicable to the Account and forms part of the key to the Limit record containing Credit Limit details. This field is also used to indicate Nostro accounts.
3-9 numeric characters consisting of a 3-7 digit Limit Reference code and optionally, a 2 digit sequence number separated by '.'. Or 'NOSTRO' to denote a Nostro Account. (Internal file, No input.)
Contains the allocated amount for the limit record linked to the account.
The amount is taken as the ONLINE.LIMIT amount for the lowest level record defined in the limit structure on the date the statment was produced.
The amount is converted from the limit currency to the account currency where required.

Indicates the end date for entries on the statement.
In a VALUE.DATED system, this date will be set the PERIOD.END date in the DATES record, as the statement will only include entries with a value date less than or equal to this date.
In a non-value dated system, the statement will only include entries with a BOOKING.DATE up to and including the system date, so the date is set to the system run date.

1C to 9C: Account Closure Statements for the Cycles 1 to 9
1S to 9S: Special Statements for the Cycles 1 to 9
